headline: Harness The Wisdom Of The Crowd To Help Your Business
summary: In 2001, Pixar was preparing to release the film "Finding Nemo." Given Pixar's track record of blockbusters, everyone expected the movie to be another hit.

headline: How Golub Capital Sees Private Credit Surviving the Software Apocalypse
summary: Business development company  Golub Capital BDC  is a longtime lender to the software industry so, not surprisingly, its earnings call dwelled on this week’s software AI apocalypse.  The fear spread to private credit firms that lend to the software companies acquired by private equity.  “AI is advancing more quickly than most people expected,” said CEO David Golub on the Thursday call.

headline: Is Salesforce’s (CRM) Army AI Deal Quietly Redefining Its Government Strategy?
summary: In late January 2026, Salesforce announced a US$5.60 billion, 10-year IDIQ contract with the U.S. Army, alongside new AI-driven partnerships and government-focused initiatives. These moves highlight how Salesforce is positioning its Agentforce AI platform and data fabric at the center of mission-critical government and infrastructure operations, even as the broader software sector wrestles with AI-driven business model questions. Against this backdrop, we’ll examine how intensifying AI...

headline: AI trade splinters as investors get more selective
summary: The global AI trade is starting to fracture as soaring capex, rising debt loads and doubts over who will profit from the technology force investors to draw sharper lines.  When ChatGPT launched in November 2022, anything linked to the artificial intelligence theme surged - from chipmakers and software firms to raw-materials suppliers ‌and even companies most exposed to AI disruption.  That lifted equity and debt markets to levels that have drawn bubble warnings from regulators and investors, even as the likes of Microsoft, Amazon, Alphabet and Meta mapped ‌out hundreds of billions of dollars in spending.

headline: The Software Rout Is Spreading Pain to the Debt Markets
summary: The steep selloff in software stocks is spreading to the debt market.  Pressured by growing worries about the disruptive potential of new AI coding tools, shares of large software companies such as Salesforce and ServiceNow have been sliding for months.

raw.headline: The Software Rout Is Spreading Pain to the Debt Markets
